question: In 1996, the Nobel Peace Prize was awarded to two East Timorese activists. Which are those two activists?
option3: Carlos Filipe Ximenes Belo and Jose Ramos-Horta
option4: Susilo Bambang Yudhoyono and Francisco Guterres
answer: Carlos Filipe Ximenes Belo and Jose Ramos-Horta
explanation: The Nobel Peace Prize 1996 was awarded jointly to two East Timorese activists Carlos Filipe Ximenes Belo and Jose Ramos-Horta for their work towards a just and peaceful solution to the conflict in East Timor.
